newsitem.title: ZAMBIA: Zambian March consumer inflation rises 32 pct y/y.
newsitem.headline: Zambian March consumer inflation rises 32 pct y/y.

text.p: Zambian consumer inflation rose just 0.8 percent month-on-month in March compared with a 5.2 percent rise in February, the Zambian Finance Ministry said on Wednesday.
Finance Minister Ronald Penza told Reuters the latest data put the country on track to reduce inflation to 15 percent by year-end from 35 percent in December 1996.
"If it continues like this we might be able to reduce it further in the next financial year," Penza said.
Year-on-year, the all-items consumer price index was up 32 percent from 34.7 percent in the previous month.
Finance Ministry officials said the fall in inflation during the month was due to price cuts in certain food items.
